titles.title: Recognizing National Homeownership Month and the importance of homeownership in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Ms. Kosmas moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 1434.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 405 - 6 (Roll no. 380).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/23/2010--Passed House without amendment. Supports the goals and ideals of National Homeownership Month. Recognizes the importance of homeownership in building strong communities and families. Reaffirms the importance of homeownership in the nation's economy and its central role in our national economic recovery.
